rComments: Super passionate professor who is not interested in whether or not you care about his class, but lays out basically every single thing that you need to know to get A's on his tests.  Lectures are long, but very interesting if you care at all about the subject, and keep up at least somewhat with the readings.  Very entertaining lecturer and person

He provided NO lecture slides/ powerpoint presentations for the class. Our 'notes' consisted of what we scrambled down on our papers while he was lecturing for an hour and 45 minutes. The tests were tricky and extremely difficult. Being a UCSC student who has never received lover than a B in a class, getting a D on his midterm was shocking.

He's a really straightforward professor which is great, but the class grade was based solely on a midterm and final 50/50. Because I didn't do exceptionally well on the first midterm the rest of the quarter was a stressful time of playing catch up. He was also the most condescending professor I've ever had. He's irritable and lets you know about it

Professor Pratkanis is great! He's very smart and passionate and has a lot of knowledge about social psychology to share. His lectures and the book, The Social Animal, leave you with a new perspective on psychology and also on society, which is probably the most important thing you can get out of a college class.

Pratkanis is an absolutely amazing professor and so passionate about the subject. His class is at 8am, but he definitely wakes you up and his class is so interesting you won't want to fall asleep. The material is easy to grasp, and the tests are very straightforward. Remember to take good lecture notes!! I'm so glad I took this class.
Went to nearly every class; however, did not do well on midterm. Book chapters felt way too long along with lecture.

Dr. Pratkanis has my utmost respect!!! An amazing, devoted, intelligent man who gives the most engaging lectures I have ever been to. I never even felt like I was in class.. I felt like I was at a show! I was honored to be in his presence. His tests are completely fair and the material is very interesting.

read the book (it's really funeasy to read if you are interested in the subject) and attend lecture and it's an easy A. his lectures were a restatement of the readings, so if you read you'll be a bit bored (though his energy keeps it from being as bad), but it's still worth attending, as lots of test questions come from his lecture.
Very intense lectures that always wake you up!!! Easy class if you read the text and attend lecture.

Best class to take my first quarter of freshman year. He's so energetic and excited to teach, making it much easier to learn. However, the class is solely graded on the midterm and final, with an optional (and difficult) annotated bibliography. I'm not a great test taker but if you take clear notes every lecture you will do fine!!

I have taken every class Anthony offers. Although they are all pretty similar, I learn something new each time. The tests are very straight forward if you do the reading and attend lecture. He assigns excellent books. His classes are always at 8am though so if you aren't a morning person I would consider taking a different course.

Pratkanis is a pretty cool teacher. He makes early morning lectures entertaining and fun and the course as a whole changed my perspective about psychology and science in general. Good books, but there are A LOT of them to read. Do most of the reading is you want to do well on his multiple choice midterm and final, that's where your grade comes from

Anthony is one of the most intelligent professors from whom I have had the privilege of learning. He is extremely well-read and has an eclectic sense of humor that I really enjoy. I learned a lot about myself and the social world through his classes and office hours. Take his class/es for an enlightening, engaging, and amusing look at human nature.

This was a good class, and I recommend taking it. A few books required to read, but they're interesting. 1 midterm and 1 final, everything on exams comes from lecture. Do not miss lecture if you plan on taking this class. Overall was a pretty easy A.

Amazing lecturer.  Teaches at 8 in the morning, but definitely keeps you awake.  Doesn't waste a minute of time.  Easy to succeed as long as you read and pay attention in lecture.  Best class and professor I've had here by a long shot.
I absolutely loved this class. He is a great professor and makes it worth it to get up for an 8 am. Easy A if you pay attention in lecture and take notes. Strongly recommended!

This class completely changed how I view the world. In a word- amazing. If you take good notes and attend lecture frequently not only will your mind be sufficiently blown but you will definitely be well prepared for the tests. Easy A if you attend lectures and study your notes/readings. My favorite class EVER! He rocks

Incredible professor. The previous comment about this being a "life-changing" class was right on the spot. Pratkanis cares about his subject, is engaging and passionate, and hilarious too. Ties with Hoffman as best psychology professor

Worth getting up early for! One of the best teachers on campus! He is always interesting and you always learn something. Keep on top of your reading! This isthe only class I have taken so far where I actually read everything! And go to lecture! Dont miss a single day because all the notes are important. He writes on the board so sit up front to see

Fantastic teacher! The textbook we used was interesting and easy to read. He speaks loud enough to wake you up and keep you engaged even if you're in an 8am class. I recommend going to all classes and doing all the reading; if you do those two things, you'll probably get an A. Also, his tests are multiple choice and there are no essays required!
Very entertaining, but has the biggest ego on campus. Very hard to approach
very famous and funny.
funny, interactive, knowledgable

His classes were the best classes I took at UCSC.  Totally worth getting up at 8am.  I didn't even need coffee...unbelievable!  He is really funny, makes lectures fun and interesting and kinda like stories so you can remember stuff easier.  His office is always full of ppl b/c everyone wants to talk to him.  He's interesting to talk to and willing to help.  AMAZING-period.

This was one of the classes I bring up when I explain what UCSC is like.  It was one of a kind, and yes, at 8AM as well.  But his energy and wit made it worthwhile.  Watching videos of Uri Gellar bending spoons didn't hurt either.  It was a magical time.
great professor! loved the class - worth getting up for 8 am class...i even went **** once...hungover many times - it was that good. kind of pompous outside of class...

LOVE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!! tried to take every class he taught but most filled up too quickly. (even got up for 8am classes on Friday to take him!!!) really knows his stuff and makes the lecture fun and funny. Projects were good too. easy going guy but a little

This is the class that made me a Psych major. Loved this guy's style. He really instilled passion in me, which is a lot to say when you consider that this was a lower division course with hundreds of students in it.
No Comments
I loved this class, and it doesnt matter that it's 8am, you'll be awake. Awsome and funny guy, and he's so great to just chat with if you go to this office hours
Greatest professor in the psych dept.  He is too much of a morning person.
witty, funny, and interesting.  awesome content and relevance between readings, lectures, and activities.  he knows what he is talking about and is a warm and approachable teacher.

8am w/this guy and you're woken up. he's so full of energy, but i think he hates his job teaching. keeps talking about how he was on Oprah or which famous person he's met. the guy really knows his stuff tho and will deliever it to you in a bundle. lectures are sooo important. dont miss any.
Very clear and interesting lectures, very helpful.
Okay class, but its at ****ing 8AM and you definitely need to go to lecture. It was a lot of busy work. I was either doing an essay or taking a test at all times. Got sick of it, but good material.
COOL CLASS COOL PROF.
there are 4 easy essays and the midterm was easy if you study.  I recommend this class!

Pratkanis is so full of himself and doesn't care what his students have to say that it makes his class entirely unfulfilling. All he talks about is the famous people he's friends with, and when a student tries to disagree with him, he shoots them down.
really fun, good guy, effective, good lectures and readings. made it worth it to wake up for an 8 am class!
Great lecturer. Makes class fun and genuinely cares about students.

I took this a while back, when it was still a seminar course.  Pratkanis is such a great lecturer though that I learned more in this course than any other I took, and that was without any quizzes or tests.  He tells stories that illustrate points well.
conveys concepts well. very organized, not interested in testing memory, but comprehension. good class for slackers who dont work as much as they think.
this one's classic, you gotta take one of his classes!

Anthony is a real nice guy, and his lectures can be interesting... The only problem I had with this class is that his lectures are just a re-telling of that chapter in the book (which he assigns to read before-hand). So if you do read the text book, his lectures will be very boring.

His lectures were super interesting even at 8am. He outlined very basically the lecture but it was up to one to take down notes. The textbook was super interesting and I recommend reading it for the midterm and final. Lecture is not mandatory but I highly recommend it for the final and midterm, which are easy as long as you read and go the class.

I took this class some years ago. Mr. Pratkanis is a BRILLIANT professor. I loved his teaching style. The best psych professor at UCSC! I learned so much and always enjoyed his lectures. He has so much energy! He was accessible outside of class and wasn't egotistical like some have mentioned. He is Harvard quality!

There are classes I've taken that I might describe great, fun, or informative. This is probably the only class that I can confidently say was "life-changing." Psych/Flim-Flam is a class that focuses on developing critical-thinking skills. If you want to learn how to pursue "truth" while also acknowledging human fallibility, take this class.

He is one of the best teachers i have ever had! hes very enthusiastic and passionate about what he does. I had class at 8 am. He did a very good job keeping me awake! His lectures are very interesting and his grading is very fair! Definitely recommend to take a class with this man!
Very enthusiastic about the subject, treats his students well, gives some of the best lectures you will ever hear.

CAN YOU WAKE UP FOR AN 8AM? I absolutely love this class! Every lecture was insightful and interesting, never disappointed. HOWEVER, this 8am made me realize just how NOT a morning person I am. Everytime I slept in and missed a class, I would wake up angry! This class is very enjoyable and worthwhile, however it's still and 8am...

Pratkanis was a little loud for an 8am, but is a very knowledgeable and energetic teacher. He made the class interesting, and the book Social Animal was actually a fun read. The class doesn't count for general eds, but is invaluable for a psych major!

Pratkanis is a pretty good professor. He's a little intense for 8 AM, which is the time of all of his classes, unless he can't get that time slot. The book he uses by Elliot Aronson is very interesting, and his tests are quite fair. The only thing is the class was graded on one midterm and the final, which is a lot of pressure. Overall, good prof.

Pratkanis is by and large the best professor I have had at UCSC. He was more than just intelligent, well spoken, and insightful, but turned me into that college student who can't stop reading the books or telling his friends/relatives about 'em. He truly inspired me, & this class taught me more IRL application than any other. Wish I had more room..

Pratkanis is an amazing teacher! All this classes were very entertaining and memorable. I recommend this class very highly. I didn't do a single page of reading and still got an A in the class. For a senior seminar, this class is a dream, no essays or exams only short hw assignments and group projects. One of the best classes at UCSC!!!

Awesome class, highly recommend! Enlightening & engaging. Popular and fills up fast. A bonus, you'll actually use the material you learn in real life. Invaluable info! Pratkanis's enthusiasm is contagious too. And sure, he can be oh so loud?at 8AM but who'd want to chose the alternative monotone can't-keep-your-eyes-open lecturer? Take this class!

Content was extremely interesting and lectures organized well. Although I found his lecturing style absurd and annoying. He really liked to yell and was just an all around goof which was really distracting. Very intense guy.

This was an awesome class. I really enjoyed it. He is a wonderful professor and makes class fun. Take lots of notes and do well on the presentations and you should be fine. No exams, but a lot of reading. Awesome siminar class.

Social Psychology of Flimflam is one of the greatest courses offered at UCSC. It begins with an understanding of what science and the psychological biases that leave people vulnerable are. Then the course goes into evaluating various pseudosciences and it's hard not to laugh or get angry. Watch Penn and Teller's show "****" to get a feel for it

An enthusiastic and passionate teacher. Lives a bit in the past, could probably use an update of the materials he uses. Beware, in the first few classes, he'll yell alot to try & get rid of anyone who doesn't truly want to be there. But it's smooth sailing after that, and you will find yourself up early in time to get to 8am class.
very arrogant.  intolerant to viewpoints that are different than his own.  if you want to get an a, kiss his ass because he plays favorites.
i loved his class, i always found it interesting... he lowered the reading load but you really have to know your material for test. tip: TAKE NOTES ON THE LITTLE READING THAT YOU DO!

GREAT! GREAT! GREAT! This was a great class, and really expanded my views and thoughts about marketing and advertising. His book Age of Propoganda is a must read. After graduating, I still find his material relevant and useful. Take at least one class from this guy. You'll also be entertained! FO SHO!

Pratkanis is a crazy energetic teacher. All I can say is that this guy consistently pulled me out of my "pitcher night at the avenue" hangover and made me want to be in class, no matter how friggin early it was. He definately has passion for the subject and a vast knowledge to draw on. The readings and lectures defiantely changed me.
